verses.text: \add Wisdom\add* reacheth from one end to another mightily: and sweetly doth she order all \add things\add*.
I loved her, and sought \add her\add* out from my youth, I desired to make \add her\add* my spouse, and I was a lover of her beauty.
In that she is conversant with God, she magnifieth \add her\add* nobility: yea, the Lord of all \add things himself\add* loved her.
For she is privy to the mysteries of the knowledge of God, and a lover of his works.
If riches be a possession to be desired in \add this\add* life; what \add is\add* richer than wisdom, that worketh all \add things?\add*
And if prudence work; who of \add all\add* that are is a more cunning workman than she?

And if a man love righteousness, her labours are virtues: for she teacheth temperance and prudence, justice and fortitude: which are such \add things\add*, as men can have nothing more profitable in \add their\add* life.

If a man desire much experience, she knoweth \add things\add* of old, and conjectureth \add aright\add* what is to come: she knoweth the subtilties of speeches, and can expound dark sentences: she foreseeth signs and wonders, and the events of seasons and times.
Therefore I purposed to take her to me to live with me, knowing that she would be a counseller of good \add things\add*, and a comfort in cares and grief.
For her sake I shall have estimation among the multitude, and honour with the elders, \add though I be\add* young.
I shall be found of a quick conceit in judgment, and shall be admired in the sight of great men.
When I hold my tongue, they shall bide my leisure, and when I speak, they shall give good ear unto \add me:\add* if I talk much, they shall lay \add their\add* hands upon their mouth.
\add Moreover\add* by the means of her I shall obtain immortality, and leave behind \add me\add* an everlasting memorial to them that \add come\add* after me.
I shall set the people in order, and the nations shall be subject unto me.
Horrible tyrants shall be afraid, when they do \add but\add* hear of me; I shall be found good among the multitude, and valiant in war.
After I am come into mine house, I will repose myself with her: for her conversation hath no bitterness; and to live with her \add hath\add* no sorrow, but mirth and joy.
\add Now\add* when I considered these \add things\add* in myself, and pondered \add them\add* in mine heart, how that to be allied unto wisdom is immortality;

and great pleasure \add it is\add* to have her friendship; and in the works of her hands \add are\add* infinite riches; and in the exercise of conference with her, prudence; and in talking with her, a good report; I went about seeking how to take her to me.
For I was a witty child, and had a good spirit.
Yea rather, being good, I came into a body undefiled.

Nevertheless, when I perceived that I could not otherwise obtain \add her\add*, except God gave \add her\add* me; and that was \add a point\add* of wisdom also to know whose gift \add she\add* was; I prayed unto the Lord, and besought him, and with my whole heart I said,
